meanings.definition: A half dome or partial dome.
meanings.sent1: The semidome of the building provided shelter from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The semidome of the church was beautifully painted with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest on the semidome, thinking it was a perfect spot.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the semidome of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streamed through the semidome, creating a warm glow inside.

meanings.definition: A curved or rounded structure that covers half of a space.
meanings.sent1: The semidome above the stage enhanced the acoustics of the theater.
meanings.sent2: The semidome of the greenhouse allowed plants to thrive in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot under the semidome of the table.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a semidome of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The semidome of the hill provided a perfect view of the sunset.

meanings.sent1: The semidome above the altar was adorned with intricate mosaics.
meanings.sent2: The semidome of the mosque added a sense of grandeur to the architecture.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel peeked out from under the semidome of the tree branch.
meanings.sent4: Her voice filled the room like a semidome of sound.
meanings.sent5: The semidome of the bridge framed the river below in a picturesque view.
